Problem involves concept of total internal reflection, occurring when light travels from higher to lower refractive index and angle of incidence exceeds critical angle.
Light travels from liquid (n = sqrt(2)) to air (refractive index ~1).
Critical angle theta_c for total internal reflection found using Snell's law: sin(theta_c) = 1/n = 1/sqrt(2) = sqrt(2)/2.
Critical angle theta_c = sin^(-1)(1/sqrt(2)) = 45 degrees.
Light ray incident at liquid-air interface at angle >= 45 degrees undergoes total internal reflection.
